channel.title: Would you fight for your country?
channel.description:
I have noticed that there is a division of people who have different militia beliefs as far as reasons to fight, respect for those who go into reserves/combatant positions, and etc.
So now I have three questions that I would like to see a good and MATURE debate about.
1) Would you fight for your country? And Why?
2) What would motivate you to join/fight for your country?
3) Is there any standing order you would refuse to do (i.e. kill on sight etc ) no matter of the punishment?

item.title: Would you fight for your country?
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:467702”]1) I would be glad to do some behind the scenes type of stuff but I would never and I mean NEVER kill others. Nor would I invade another country, obviously I suppose it would depend on the situation solely.
2) Would depend on your situation/on personal events that surround you. It’s sort of like the “what would you do if your brother” question
3) Murder, no matter what. It isn’t a religous thing I just don’t it fair to take the life of another no matter of what.[/quote]
i agree 1000%

Read full topic
item.source: Would you fight for your country?

item.title: Would you fight for your country?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Just because I don’t have a conscience and don’t elaborate my feelings like most people, doesn’t make me a “mind drone”. I think, and do whatever I want to. And I WANT to fight for my country, I don’t see any problems considering our government didn’t put out war propaganda to trick millions of people into fighting. We aren’t exposed to a ton of subliminal messages as well.

you forgot the illuminati m8

Read full topic

item.title: Would you fight for your country?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“xxxtilllyxxx, post:149, topic:467702”]1) Would you fight for your country? And Why? - I would, I already am planning to join the RMCC(Royal Military College of Canada), to become a fighter pilot. I just feel it’s the morally acceptable thing to do. My other family members have fought, why should I have to love it up for them?

  1. What would motivate you to join/fight for your country? - Don’t need motivation.

  2. Is there any standing order you would refuse to do (i.e. kill on sight etc ) no matter of the punishment? - I’d do anything asked to as long as I’m not seeing repercussions.[/quote]
    Another mindless drone that will commit war crimes…

Read full topic

  2. What would motivate you to join/fight for your country? - Don’t need motivation.

item.title: Would you fight for your country?
item.dc:creator: @jamie233 jamie233
item.description:
@jamie233 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:144, topic:467702”][quote author=jamie233 link=topic=584645.msg4246068#msg4246068 date=1362093877]

jamie223: When did Iraq, Libya and Syria try to attack you?

Doesn’t really matter who started it because unless you actually know the straight facts or were there, your opinion is unjustified. They try to kill me, I’m going to kill them. Easy, as that I’m going to protect my people regardless of if our Country started it or not.
[/quote]
Quick question. Should Fidel Castro be allowed to kill every US president that tried to kill him (Of those who are still alive).[/quote]
well

propaganda spread by the wealthy or greedy in the usa.
caused the Usa to hate and corrupt what communism is about. I only think it would be justified, and Fidel couldn’t succeed not to undermine him, but it’s just general history and studying U.S history that makes me believe he would never succeed without a lot of help. Well, I mean back then because my country is getting weak from a corrupt system, I am leaving soon because I believe it’s an endless war here that will lead to the U.S become United States of China or Soviet Russia xD, our economy is shit, everything is expensive, it’s like $4 a gallon, $7.25 for a pack of newports, unjustified court sentencing, corrupt gov’t, and not to mention Barrack Osama.

item.title: Would you fight for your country?
item.dc:creator: @jamie233 jamie233
item.description:
@jamie233 wrote:

  1. Would you fight for your country? And Why?
    A: Yes, as a U.S citizen we are hated around the world and since we have a lot of land people will want to endanger my/our families lives, I will fight for my country and the people. Yes, I think violence is wrong, but it’s necessary when it means your life. “It’s survival of the fittest”.

  2. What would motivate you to join/fight for your country?
    A: above I explained why and just to keep citizens safe.

  3. Is there any standing order you would refuse to do (i.e. kill on sight etc ) no matter of the punishment?
    No there is no unreasonable killing generally in our military. You try to kill me, I’m going to kill you, easy as that. I’d rather have it be you than me.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you fight for your country?
